name: Gluten-Free Buckwheat Brownies
author: Crystal Austin-Wong
summary: These are slightly fudge-like but almost cake-like brownies made with semisweet chocolate and buckwheat flour. The texture and flavor are surprisingly light for buckwheat flour! If you like your brownies sweeter, add more sugar.
ingredients: ½ cup white sugar, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) on convection heat
Place chocolate and butter in the top of a double boiler over simmering water
Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes
Pour chocolate mixture into a large bowl and stir in sugar
Cool slightly, then beat in eggs, 1 at a time
In a separate bowl, mix buckwheat flour, baking soda, and salt together
Add to chocolate mixture, stirring constantly to mix well
Pour batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth out the top
Bake in the preheated oven until top is dry and edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, 20 to 25 minutes
